content:
Does anyone know the status of the log crate (https://github.com/rust-lang/log) maintainers? There are a number of open prs that look ready to merge (including some of my own), but there is very little activity.

I'm willing to help out maintaining the crate.
sfackler is still active in rust-postgres, at least

To revive this topic again, nothing has really changed.
I'm willing to help maintaining myself. Is there anyone who can help out setting that up from the Rust org (on GitHub)?

Org membership is managed through the team repo, you can submit a PR there to join.
And yeah, the libs team is nominally in charge of this crate.
many of the official rust-lang crates are maintained in the sense that bugs are fixed, but for many no new features are accepted, because of the limited bandwidth.

@Mara I get that, but this has been a feature in works for a couple of years now. I know @Ashley Mannix has put in a lot of work and I feel it's like 80% there, but without the last 20% it's just not usable.

The 8472 said:

Org membership is managed through the team repo, you can submit a PR there to join.
And yeah, the libs team is nominally in charge of this crate.

Should I create a new team for the log crate? Because I don't think I want to be pinged on all libs related issues.
Also should I do the same for rust-lang/socket2? I actively maintain that but I'm not in any libs teams for it (as far as I know)
Yeh it would be great to have a team set up for log maintenance :smile: I’ve still been chipping away at the edges @Thomas de Zeeuw maybe we should look at what we need to get it fully over the line
I think the main thing we need is to be able to commit to the repo and make releases on crates.io
